title: Seared Scallops with Sweet Potato Purée

ingredients.content: 3 oz leeks, white part only, cut into pieces
6 oz sweet potatoes, peeled, cut into pieces (approx. 1 sm.)
½ vanilla bean, seeds scraped out (optional)
1 pinch ground white pepper, to taste
6 jumbo sea scallops, cleaned, patted dry with paper towels

preparations.content: Place leeks and ¼ tsp salt into mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add sweet potatoes and chop a further <b>4 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add water, stock paste, vanilla bean seeds and vanilla bean pod, cider vinegar, ginger and white pepper and cook <b>15 min/212°F/speed 1<b>. Meanwhile 3-5 minutes before purée is finished cooking, begin heating a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add oil to skillet, season scallops with ½ tsp salt and pepper and cook until browned (approx. 2 min. per side). Transfer to a plate and keep warm.
Add milk to mixing bowl and purée <b>1 min/speed 5<b>-10<b> increasing speed gradually. Adjust seasoning to taste.
To serve, divide sweet potato purée between two plates and top with seared scallops. Garnish with arugula and blackberries and serve warm.
